The Dynamic Radio Sky Conference 2025 | 28 July-1 August, 2025
Code of Conduct Conference Dinner Logistics Participant List Programme Registration

Travel and Visa Information

Everyone entering Australia needs a visa, except for Australian and New Zealand citizens. For significant fees, many companies will help you to get a visa but you can do this yourself through the Australia government site ImmiAccount. Depending on nationality, you will need either an eVisitor visa, ETA, or a traditional visa.

The most convenient airport is Sydney Kingsford Smith Airport (SYD), which is 9km (5.5mi) from the city and the university. You can take the train from the airport to the city. The train takes about 10 minutes to central station and costs $AUD16.68. For all public transport (bus, ferry, light rail, train), you can use either an Opal card or a contactless payment.

Alternatively, hire cars, rideshare and taxi services, and shuttles are conveniently available to book prior to your arrival, or on the day. For more information about travel from the airport, please see Sydney Airport Transport Options.

Venue

The workshop will be held in the Physics Building at University of Sydney. Registration will be open Monday morning from 9 a.m., with morning and afternoon tea served in the auditorium foyer.

Conference Slack

We encourage you to join the Slack workspace. This Slack workspace will be utilized for LOC and SOC announcements during the workshop, as well as a platform for asking questions, engaging in discussions, and connecting with speakers.

Public Transport

The nearest train station to the campus is Redfern Station, a short walk from the University of Sydney. For more details on Sydneyâ€™s public transport, please visit Transport NSW.

Parking

See here for more details.

Accommodation

There are several accommodation options near the University of Sydney, see here for more details.

For those looking to stay in Sydney CBD, any of the excellent hotels there offer a short commute via train or bus.

Online Participation

Talks will be streamed on Zoom, with a link sent out to registered participants shortly before the workshop. Online participants can ask questions through the Slack workspace, as the Zoom Q&A feature will be disabled.
